content: Hi everyone, I am an intern and about to complete my graduation from my bachelors degree in information technology. As the topic name suggests I am very new to rust, but I want to conftibute to it, so how much rust do I need to know to do so and where to start?

You may want to look at the rustc dev guide. You could start trying to fix an issue marked as E-easy. Are there any particular parts of the compiler you are interested in? Or do you prefer contibuting to something like the standard library or documentation? In any case feel free to ask questions here or in #t-compiler/help.

Thanks for replying :raised_hands:

Are there any particular parts of the compiler you are interested in?

I wish to contribute to the compiler and will checkout the docs to decide and be sure to follow up on the suggested chanel :+1:
